oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A NUMERICAL WAVE PREDICTION MODEL FOR PERSONAL COMPUTERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schwab, David J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: personal computer
numerical model
prediction model
wave prediction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A two-dimensional wave prediction model suitable for use on personal computers is described. The model requires the twodimensional time-dependent wind field as input. Output consists of wave height, wave period, and wave direction estimates at all grid points on a computational grid representing an enclosed or semi-closed basin. Model predictions compare favorably with observations from a wave research tower in Lake Erie. A formula is provided to estimate how long a model simulation would take on a personal computer given the surface area of the computational domain, the grid size, and the computer clock speed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 222
